sect1.para: kdelibs can use many optional libraries and programs. The following are recommended: , , , , , cups, and .
Other programs and libraries that can be used by kdelibs are: libfam
Install kdelibs with: ./configure --prefix=&kde-dir; --enable-objprelink \ --disable-debug --disable-dependency-tracking --with-alsa \ --enable-fast-malloc=full && make && make install

sect2.title: kdelibs Installation Commmand explanations
sect2.para: --prefix=&kde-dir;: This option tells the process to install the package in &kde-dir;.

warning.para: objprelink has been known to cause problems on some systems. If it does not work on your system you will have to rebuild kde without it. This applies to all KDE packages.

sect2.para: --enable-objprelink: This option enables the linking process to optimize executable loading times by prelinking many internal references.
--disable-debug: This option causes the system to be compiled without debugging code.
--disable-dependency-tracking: This option speeds up one time builds.
--with-alsa: This option tells the build process to search for and use Alsa for sound support.
--enable-fast-malloc=full: This option tells KDE programs to use an internal memory allocation scheme optimized for KDE.

sect2.title: Configuring kdelibs
sect2.para: There is no additional configuration to do for kdelibs.
